bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Dean Cornwell, July 6, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests that Cornwell omit the mustache from Moran's image in the yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Dean Cornwell, July 6, 1941
div1.p:
Charge to the account of________________$_________
WESTERN
UNION
1206-B
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________

Send the following telegram, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to
JULY 6 1941 DEAN CORNWELL

GAINSBOROUGH STUDIOS 222 CENTRAL PARK SOUTH
NEWYORK NY

MORAN NOTIFIES ME PHOTO I SENT YOU TAKEN 1905 FEATURES WERE
AS OF 1900 BUT HAD NO MUSTACHE IN 1900 PLEASE OMIT MUSTACHE
FROM PAINTING

July 8, 1941 Mr. Dean Cornwell
Gainsborough Studios
222 Central Park South
New York City

I sincerely hope that my sending you the photo-
graph of Moran has not confused rather than helped you.
Mr. Kellogg told me more than once that he had been unable
to find a photograph of Moran taken anywhere near 1900 and
Moran told me that several times himself. Therefore, last
week when I came across the photograph of Moran which I
sent you, I was rather elated, thinking that it would help
you considerably. On the back there was a label, suggesting
that it was taken in 1900 or very near that date. I sent
Moran a copy and as my wire indicates I just had a cable
from him saying that the photograph was taken in 1905 and
that he had no mustache in 1900. I hope you haven't gone
to the trouble of painting in a mustache and if so, I hope
you can find some white wash to remove it!

I have no anticipations of interfering any more
with suggestions for the painting. I know it will be a
fine painting.
